intro: Selenodesmium saxatile, commonly known as the saxatile selenodesmium, is a member of the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, and often hairy leaves that help it store water and reduce transpiration. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, adding a vibrant touch to its habitat. Selenodesmium saxatile is well adapted to harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
